website_summaries.verdict: Extremely affordable and form-fitting. This low-budget bag is perfect for photographers just starting to hit the road.
pros: The bag's comfortable to wear and isn't bulky
Has areas for accessories, lenses, and a tripod
cons: The overall structure is flimsy and the inside dividers may lose their shape after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the essentials plus a few extras
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is the perfect size to be functional but also comfortable enough for any shooting position without feeling encumbered by a huge weight on my back. The construction is nice and sturdy with a simple design and the adjustable dividers allow you to customize the padded compartments to your equipment needs. You're not going to find a professional, "carry everything" bag in this $20.00 price point. What you do get is a nice backpack to use as an everyday bag that will hold your essentials for a great day of shooting. This bag holds my Canon 80D, 18-55mm lens, 55-250mm lens, 18-135mm lens, flash, several filters, 12 SD card case and spare battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: hrstar

customer_reviews.title: like others have posted
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, like others have posted, the dividers are too flimsy. I like having the camera at the top of the bag so that if I sit down with it, it won't get crushed. Similarly, if I set the bag down too hard, it would take the full brunt since it sits at the bottom of the bag. Here's what it looks like after a few minutes of use. The camera is now sunk down and all the contents inside the bag are willy nilly. I do like that the bag has the right depth for my items. I may end up purchasing my own means of adding dividers to the bag...
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Backpack.  Fit Two Cameras,  3 lens, and 3 battery packs.
customer_reviews.text: First, this backpack is not for everyone. I was able to adjust everything to fit just right. You have to do some adjusting to this backpack. There is a little strap in the bag that you can use to hold down the top dlsr camera to keep it from sliding down. Was even able to fit another camera into the bag. I even put a 10'' inch laptop in the front lid This backpack is small & not all bad.
customer_reviews.author: Capri

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy. Came with a tear in the front flap
customer_reviews.text: Partly my fault for not doing much about this. It came with a large tear in the front flap so I never used it. I was too busy at the time to send it back. Maybe I'll sew it sometime but hell no would I put 2k+ gear in there. Not even 1k. The bag isnt super sturdy. If you have nice gear I'd stay away... I got this hoping I could use it as a backup to my dlsr bag but I would spend more and get a decent one. There are tons of options
customer_reviews.author: BobertphotoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice size camera backpack
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a single strap bag and the Vivitar bag is so much easier to carry. Not very bulky at all and I didn't think I could fit everything but it all fit (std lense, zoom, wide angle, fish eye, chargers, microphone, 2 flashes, and batteries. The only thing missing which would be nice would be a small compartment to carry memory cards. The insulation is decent but I would prefer a thicker bottom for more protection. Otherwise, very happy with the backpack!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I do not really like the quality and longevity
customer_reviews.text: It has been almost a year and I have only taken it to a couple of trips in the car. The quality is not good, it doesn't hold its shape well. The shoulder straps starting to fray and separate from the seams. Not that I always walk with my gear. I mostly leave them in the car, while just taking what I need with me. Overall, it did not really meet my expectations. I wish I should've just got a hard case like Apache 3800 for roughly the same price. I know it's a different type of case, but would be perfect for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: kgman

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Backpack at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this camera backpack for a few months now and I am very happy with the quality and functionality. I do a lot of hiking and always want to have my camera and a few lenses with me. I like being able to customize the compartments to keep my lenses & camera secure. The outer side pockets are handy for carrying a mono- or tripod, notepad, snacks, and will accommodate a slim profile water bottle. The zipper operates smoothly. I would recommend this backpack to other photographers.
customer_reviews.author: cwpaso

customer_reviews.title: Not too big – Not too small!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a great size for urban photography and small day hikes. It has enough dividers to customize your stash as you wish. The materials seem sturdy enough and the side features a handy pouch and strap that fits my compact tripod nicely. Can be worn comfortably over one shoulder, on the back (as intended) or held by hand with the convenient handle on top of the bag. Nice bag! No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Doc MOJOMAN

customer_reviews.title: The seller was exemplary and provided excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the product only. The seller was exemplary and provided excellent customer service. This product is made with velcro partitions and they are LOUSY. The velcro will not hold the weight of an SLR or even a decent sized lens without separating. If you have anything more than light-weight accessories and a very small camera then this bag is NOT for you.
customer_reviews.author: Gruvdog

customer_reviews.title: Easy to configure inside to fit your lenses/camera bodies
customer_reviews.text: Well made, sleek construction. Easy to configure inside to fit your lenses/camera bodies. It fits my Canon camera with attached 70-200 lens, 50 mm, 18-135, 35mm, and assorted caps, chargers and wires... all in a neat and tidy backpack! The price was GREAT! I was looking at more expensive bags and watched the videos that other customers posted of the inside of the bag and decided to try it out - very, very pleased!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY - TOO FLIMSY
customer_reviews.text: I'm so bummed. I was so excited to receive the travel backpack but the camera is too heavy for the compartments and it just slides down. In the third photo you can see how it's SUPPOSED to look based on what the show in advertisement photo but every time I pick up the backpack the camera weight causes it to slide forward and out of the compartments. WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.author: Lori Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: I like that it doesn’t immediately look like a camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly adequate for your small camera bag needs. I like that it doesn’t immediately look like a camera bag, and the compact size makes it great for photographers with small frames (or who just don’t want to haul around the entire kit for a run-and-gun shoot or a day at the park or whatever). The movable dividers are nice and sturdy, overall construction feels solid. Wish it had maybe one more zippered pocket, but so far I’m managing fine on the available pockets.
customer_reviews.author: J Lin

customer_reviews.title: Much nicer than the gym bag type.
customer_reviews.text: I just got into taking photos and bought a kit camera and a carrying bag. The gym bag type is OK, but its a pain with the shoulder strap and such. This thing holds what I need and then some and fits well as a backpack. I'm a big guy, so I was a bit surprised that this fit as well as it does. I looked at nicer ones of these types, but for the money, this works well.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag For Beginners, or school use.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for beginners, Just know A Cannon 5d with a standard lens will not fit in the bag, Works fine for the Cannon T5i/T6i, There is some padding, I just wouldn't bring anything that cost to much not that protective. Pros, tripod holder, plenty of room for extra lens/battery's/filters. even a few Go pros, Cons, Not much padding, Cant hold a cannon full frame DSLR,
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, very practical.
customer_reviews.text: This bag pack is great, everything my wife owns fits in it, two lenses a camera and a large flash plus multiple small accessories, she has a mono-pod that is not on the way because she can carry it outside. There is plenty of space left for when she adds more accessories to her camera. The quality is also great and the material is good does not look cheap and is easy to clean. The last thing you want is having to worry about not being able to put your camera bag in the floor.
customer_reviews.author: A B

customer_reviews.title: Durable and compact!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent backpack for your camera and all accoutrements. I’m surprised how many things fit in this bag perfectly without being bulky. It’s much better than my camera bag. I like that it offers handsfree versus weighing my shoulders down. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Everything Fits Snug
customer_reviews.text: My camera and all its lenses, battery pack, flash, etc fits in this backpack snug. I had ordered this and another to see which I prefer, and this one held everything the best. The dividers are flimsy but with how I have everything packed it, I'm not worried about it.
customer_reviews.author: L. FarmerTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: It's not a bad backpack bag but not the best, or close to it.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and looked at the pictures prior to buying this. Honestly it's my fault for this review. It doesn't have much storage for sd cards, etc. If there was an outside pocket I really would have loved this bag. The dividers are decent, however everything kept sliding in my bag. I do like the tripod holder. The zipper is decent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall review of the bag
customer_reviews.text: Really convinient and compact camera back. You don't really have small pockets on the outside that zip and things like that, but for the size of it it can fit a lot of gear. There's like a small pocket inside where you can actually carry the SD cards and some filters, other than inside my bag I have my full frame Nikon ( with 24-120mm on it), my old DSLR ( body only), couple of extra batteries+ charger, 3 small/medium lenses (35mm, 50mm, and the kit lenses for the old DSLR 18-55mm). So far I've had it for about a lil bit over a week. Pretty much I'm very satisfied with what I got for that price.
customer_reviews.author: Nikola

customer_reviews.title: Nice little backpack
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is a little small but it will hold a Canon 7D, 3 lens, flash and a few other accessories. Stitching looks good and the only thing I would like to have done is to make the top area where the camera is stored, deeper. You will have to be careful about taking the camera out or else it may fall out. I would suggest laying the backpack down flat prior to removal of your camera. Other than that, it appears to be a nice little pack to keep handy for "in the moment" trips. For the price, I don't think you can beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: If you would like to go to a store and see feel something ...
customer_reviews.text: At first I was a little skeptical since this was not an Amazon pick, or a bestseller. But after receiving it it holds my Canon T6 with an 18 to 55 mm lens attached plus for other lenses that I keep in there. 2 spare batteries and a flash. Everything fits proerpply and is well protected. Back pack is not overly big or bulky. For the price can't complain at all. If you would like to go to a store and see feel something roughly the same go to Best Buy they sell it for $58
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy pack with compartments which can be created and recreated by movable pieces of velcro-edged nylon strips. Important to note, if you travel frequently by air and want a personal item without an additional charge, this item meets the measurement guidelines for what can be stowed under a seat on a plane. I packed camera equipment in it, plus some toiletries and an extra top and pair of socks, plus my IPad and a magazine. Roomy with a solid zipper. Good Product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice big bag
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice big bag, everything described as shown, the only thing I don't like is the mesh pocket, I think instead of having a small strip of velcro it should have a zipper there, because when you have it open to get or organize your camera, everything in the mesh pocket slips out... (I'm going to add extra velcro on mine).. other than that it's a nice size camera bag, my camera fits I have extra pockets to fill in, i can even add my selfie stick in there... ;)
customer_reviews.author: MsAna

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Really good. Have a D800, a 70-200 vr2, a 28mm and a 500mm, as well as a tablet, some chargers, and SD cards and sim cards. Very comfortable and seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Chase the Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and 3-4 additional lenses plus additional gear- while being small and comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I anticipated but exactly what I was looking for to carry my camera/light video gear. Large enough to carry my full frame body with a 70-200 attached, and 3-4 additional lenses plus additional gear- while being small and comfortable to wear. The bag is simple and understated, which is also something I wanted while exploring different cities with my gear. Priced right, fits right and a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Monahan

customer_reviews.title: This bag has been great for organizing my 3 camera lenses and accessories
customer_reviews.text: This bag has been great for organizing my 3 camera lenses and accessories! The soft padding surrounding each lens in the bag is also a plus. I would recommend this bag for a starter for sure! I only wish things didn't move around while in the upright position ( on my back)... Hence the 4-Star review.
customer_reviews.author: Virg0_07

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag for fellow beginners
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bag to accomodate my Canon Rebel T6, 2 lenses, a flash, 2 lens hoods, cleaning kit, 2 battery chargers, a wide angle, a fisheye, and some lens filters. Everything fits beautifully. The mesh pouch is great for storing manuals and cleaning wipes, and all of the dividers are attached with velcro, so it is very easy to move things around to accommodate what you have. I would highly recommend this bag to fellow beginners.
customer_reviews.author: LadyAwesome93

customer_reviews.title: seems to be of good quality. A few reviewers had stated that their ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, seems to be of good quality. A few reviewers had stated that their camera slips down. Easy fix, I just reversed the compartment dividers and no problem. It holds my 400 mm lens, plus a 28-80 and a 18-50 mm lens. perfect for my needs. Haven't used the tripod holder yet ...
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Easily carries cameras and binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Shipped on time and as described. It has lots of space for my olympus pen camera with the optional vf3 viewfinder and 40-150mm lens. I can also fit in other accessories and lenses. I can also carry a set of binoculars, a flashlight, a GPS unit. Etc. The backpack is quite light so I prefer to take it with me on my evening strolls as Ingo bird watching.
customer_reviews.author: SlideScanner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bag for my set of tools!
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect for my Photography set of tools. I have my body camera plus 2 lenses, a tripod, the camera charger, a 360 camera an a small tripod and all of them fit perfectly inside this bag and it still has a perfect size. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: ebr319

customer_reviews.title: Great and spacious bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag works well for camera equipment. Seems to be durable and I feel safe putting expensice gear in it. My first one came with a defect and they had a new one shipped out to me within 24 hours to replace it. Great customer service and a great camera bag especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Randi K.

customer_reviews.title: So far it feels like a ok back pack for carrying my camera and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it feels like a ok back pack for carrying my camera and lens however the problem I have with it is it feels like everything shift around too easily like it's too flimsy. I've tried moving the dividers around but it didn't help much. When I open just the top to get my camera it feels like everything will just slide right out of their places. I might as well take off the whole thing and lay it down to get anything out. This backpack is probably best if just using it to get your gear from point A to B and not constantly getting in and out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera bag. For me it holds a couple of cameras, lenses, cords,chargers and batteries. I love having everything in one place and everything is protected. I can move the dividers around to fit my needs and it is light weight, which is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Debi

customer_reviews.title: This is a small light weight backpack.
customer_reviews.text: This holds my camara well and any another little stuff I need to carry. The only thing I would change would be making the side waterbottle holder a little bigger and maybe and a small zipped pocket on the outside. another than that I used it for about 7hrs straight the other day and it was not digging in any where it should not be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits both my cameras and still room for more!
customer_reviews.text: So far I really am LOVING this bag. I have two cameras and am able to carry them, their lenses a Rode Mic and I still have extra room for my small Gorilla Pod, batteries and cords. It’s a true black color and honestly it’s not heavy at all. I also like how adjustable the velcro sectionals are. Leaves you with personal options to organize your own equipment. I have yet to try to put a tripod in the side pocket but even if that doesn’t work I am honestly very satisfied, it being my first Camera bag and all.
customer_reviews.author: Chanda

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great backpack and it’s really spacious. The security strap on the sides holds my large tripod really good. The material feels durable and I throw my backpack all over when I go shooting and it still looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Mosqueda

customer_reviews.title: Really like this backpack
customer_reviews.text: Really like this backpack, I needed a bigger bag after getting two lenses for Christmas. This holds my 5 lenses, the camera and a few accessories very comfortably. The bag is slim and not bulky, fits on my shoulders nicely, I was really drawn to it because of the changeable insides, which work great!
customer_reviews.author: Elabruzzo92

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Update: I unexpectedly received a replacement bag today in the mail and will raise my reviews for the time being. I will test this bag and hope that the other one was just a defect. Will update in time. I dont typically write reviews, but this bag was a bit disappointing... The bookbag has good design in the sense that it fits a lot, but unfortunately lacks on quality. I'm currently abroad and it started coming apart on the seems by the handle. I still have 3 flights to catch before I make it home and hope it can survive the trip.
customer_reviews.author: irina Radomislsky

customer_reviews.title: He Loved It
customer_reviews.text: The recipient loved this bag, and was able to store his mini tripod, his cameras, and lenses in it for some shots in the mountains. Sleek and lightweight, but still padded and protective of camera equipment. Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great fist bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my canon t6i and it fits great. the insides can be adjusted, although the material isn't that high end. Very light and comfortable. I do suggest keeping everything capped just because there is velcro inside the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a bag, it works, it's not the best, but it works
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to write a great review for this bag! There are good and bad things, the zipper broke pretty quickly and has always been hard to open and close. The compartments dont really hold everything in place very well. That being said, It works. It's a bag. I've used it for several months and it gets the job done. I just bought a new bag but I will keep this one just in case because it does work. It fits almost all my essentials and a big tripod on the side. Not bad
customer_reviews.author: Peter Compton

customer_reviews.title: If only it could have been leather or pleather
customer_reviews.text: Looks can be deceiving - great package, good feel on the back, just needs one more compartment. Close but no cigar - on to another hunt for the perfect bag.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dawson

customer_reviews.title: It is a very good bag for the price and should be great for ...
customer_reviews.text: It works but doen not seem as rugged as some of my nicer bags. It is a very good bag for the price and should be great for the average camera guy. If you are someone that takes a camera everywhere they go (like every weekend) this one may not be sturdy enough for you.
customer_reviews.author: Chico

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable. I found myself using my iPhone instead of my expensive camera because my previous camera bag was so clunky and uncomfortable. I carried this around all day on vacation and barely noticed it was there.
customer_reviews.author: M Faith

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This pack is a great value! It is light weight and a good day trip bag for organizing your camera and lenses. If you want a super sturdy bag to protect your investment, look elsewhere. But, if you're looking for a simple, nondescript way to carry your camera and a couple of lenses out into the field, this bag is it!
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: This backpack is great. The only negative thing is the mesh pocket ...
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is great. The only negative thing is the mesh pocket it has on the inside is only closed with a small piece of Velcro, it would be much better if it was able to close with a zipper or a piece of Velcro that goes the whole way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: not too big , not too small , just perfect ! I was able to fit all the accessories I have for my camera with room to spare . Very happy with this purchase !
customer_reviews.author: IR1977

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it's great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect DSLR bag. You can bring four of your favorite lenses, lens cleaning equipment, batteries, charger, tripod and filters. Everything you need. I would have paid more if the bag was made more rugged with a harder shell.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product bought on sale, very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack; I'm able to carry all my equipment, full size DSLR Camera, small 1080p camcorder and my 4K underwater camera with accessories and still have room. Highly recommend to buy this when on sale. Very comfortable to carry on my back.
customer_reviews.author: HappyJoyJoy

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter is in a photography class and needed something to carry her equipment around. This was perfect!!! Great quality and the compartments are able to be moved around and customized to what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gandy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I thought this was a hard shell but nonetheless it was still a great buy. Love how compact it is and still holds all my gear....it's very sleek looking( which was the selling point for me) and its comfortable to wear. I would LOVE if they consider making a textured hard shell version
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: very nice bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: very nice bag for the price. every dividing wall you see in the bag is held in place with Velcro, so you can rearrange it to fit however you want
customer_reviews.author: Puck

customer_reviews.title: Small backpack that can carry a lot photo equipment
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for air travel . For hand carry.Small but can carry a lot. Seems like they built it for near exact fit. Its smaller than I expected. It looks to have great material. I hope it can last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Rod M.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy on your back when full
customer_reviews.text: Small little carrying bag for your camera and a couple small lenses. Compact and easy on your back when full. The inserts can also be arranged to your liking.
customer_reviews.author: Aztec K.

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have to worry about where to put all of my lenses anymore. Although I don’t have any huge ones, it fits 4 lenses, extra battery and charger and the camera body quite well. The pockets on the sides are nice and I have been able to strap my tripod to the Velcro loop on the outside of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite camera bag!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera bag. I use it every day! I like that I can customize the compartments. My Canon EOS T4i with a battery grip, a telephoto lens, and a tripod mount fits fine. I have lots of filters and remotes and other photographers junk...
customer_reviews.author: Weston Ney Photo Video

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: I have carried around four digital lenses, an external flash, my DSLR, my film camera body, and one more film lens in this thing no problem. The velcro pocket inside keeps all my SD cards and cleaning supplies close. I love that I can carry around a water bottle as well as a tripod, too—I carry this thing with me everywhere! It's perfect for how cheap it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gear protection
customer_reviews.text: Is OK. It holds the product but isn't sturdy enough to my taste. I would like it to provide better protection for the gear. Right price though.
customer_reviews.author: Javier delPino

customer_reviews.title: Nicely laid out - a little larger than I thought, but can fit a lot of gear.
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson was able to get most of his camera equipment in it and took it on a trip. Will hear how functional it was when he gets back.
customer_reviews.author: JStuart

customer_reviews.title: I like it's sleek design
customer_reviews.text: Really does the trick, keeps my camera and lenses in place/safe and has plenty of room for other miscellaneous items I want to shove in. I like it's sleek design, sort of reminds me of a jetpack which I think is kinda fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive & good quality
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack. It’s an inexpensive option to easily carry my gear. I carry a camera body, 3 lenses, and all of my accessories to my sessions. **this also meets TSA requirements for a carry on bag.
customer_reviews.author: mom of three

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Camera Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for short hikes around Monterey Bay area. Will hold my camera, telephoto lens and a few basic items needed for hiking. Needed something lightweight as my other camera backpack is large and bulky. Would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: NANCY COLANGIONE

customer_reviews.title: Fits EVERYTHING!
customer_reviews.text: Love this gear bag. Fits EVERYTHING including my mavic pro drone, two gopros, point-and-shoot vlog camera, mounts, harddrive, external chargers ... all at once! The design is super sleek and I love the look. Could see it working for both guys and girls. Seriously so stoked on this purchase. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Adri Yedi

customer_reviews.title: Great for Magic the gathering
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good bag that can hold multiple deck boxes of various sizes. I carry six decks (4 commander, 1 standard, 1 pioneer) and a box of draft lands. It would have been perfect if it had a place to put my trade binder.
customer_reviews.author: Demon_Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap materials, would not trust it with my camera and gear.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera bag / backpack because it had decent reviews on Amazon, however, I was very disappointed with the low quality and did not trust it to keep my gear safe. In the end I return to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Josephus Heun

customer_reviews.title: Good size, compact
customer_reviews.text: Good size, compact, but still able to fit a lot of gear, material looks strong. The only reason I don't give it five star its because it has a Velcro pocket inside and everything I put in the falls out, if they put a zipper on that it would it be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional photographer but usually I carry some lenses, tripod, and stuff when I go out shooting for a couple of hours. The dividers are configurable, so you can make the compartments as you want. I only miss a space for my tablet, but I realized that would be a different bag model. So, I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro Pedro da Silva

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Small, durable and sturdy. This what i need to bring to travel. Comfortable too! I have nikon d500 with 3 lenses, a flash, and extra batteries. Fits everything. Happy i found this.
customer_reviews.author: Itangz

customer_reviews.title: The velcro compartments don't hold up
customer_reviews.text: Functional, but the padded compartments shift and I don't trust it to protect my gear. I did take it with me on a shoot and the fact that it was a backpack made it functional.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Freaking love this pack
customer_reviews.text: Take all my gearbox in just this bag. Fit camera, two lens, containers with different things and more!!! I even lean back on this back sometimes during photoshoors and it has my gear protected!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Whipple

customer_reviews.title: Great service and product!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the fastest delivery I have ever experienced. I ordered this camera backpack for my sister and she raved about it, so I ordered one for myself. Very happy, product was better than I expected. Will use Goja from now on!
customer_reviews.author: TinaTheAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Very handy...easier than Nikon bag!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Nikon bag...love it! Just which there was more safety for the camera to be "strapped" into the bag, in it's position.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry S.

customer_reviews.title: Not good if you don’t fill the whole bag
customer_reviews.text: I guess the main problem with it, If you are using a small lens, the bag won’t hold the camera inside where you leave it. I don’t think this bag is easy to use it for begineers. But if you have a lot of gadgets to out it in, it may actually be better choice since you are filling all gaps in it, and they can’t move.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Little small. Have a hard time zipping up the ...
customer_reviews.text: Little small. Have a hard time zipping up the bag with a cannon mark III with lens attached. The shoulder straps are small in length adjusments.
customer_reviews.author: christophertaylor

customer_reviews.title: Great for on the go
customer_reviews.text: I love the bag for easy on the go. I wish there was more pockets or section to hold camera more tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Olsen

customer_reviews.title: So close to perfection
customer_reviews.text: The exterior if the bag is nice. The interior just feals cheap and not sure it would protect my camera. The top area of backpack where it is shown to go there is a lot of extra space where camera can wobble around. But I know that the sides are the material that they are so the Velcro things can stick to it. Good product 4.8/5.0
customer_reviews.author: Ben E.

customer_reviews.title: Really good backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any problems with my lens slipping around at all. I've worn this pack around all day, and i have pretty big lens I cart around. The pack is comfortable, with plenty of spaces for my 4 lens, camera and extras.
customer_reviews.author: Darian Criag

customer_reviews.title: You get your money’s worth
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid of getting this bag because i thought it would be too big for me, the design was truly was convinced me to get it. I am very happy purchased it! Storage is better than I imagined, currently storing: t6, 18-55mm, 75-300mm, wide angle 58mm, 380ex, cleaning supplies, umbrella, pouch of filters and I still have space! Design is very dope and it does not look big at all
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect high end but it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great little back pack for go pro type stuff but I'm not completely sold on stuffing my $1000 worth of lenses and dslr into it. Time will tell. I will say that it is everything they describe it to be. For the money. I have minimal complaints.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: The Velcro section do fall.
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to carry my camera around. The only issue is the Velcro sections are not very dependable. They separate and everything falls together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its OK.. could be better
customer_reviews.text: There are better products in the market. If you have expensive gear or a lot of them - padding or shock absorbing capacity is not very assuring. Insie looks somewhat cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Equator

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for beginner photographers. My boyfriend loves this. He’s had it about 8 months now and fits all of his equipment perfectly and the inside is adjustable. Great bag especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: SFreNewby

customer_reviews.title: Fits DJI Mavic Pro
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as an alternative to the ever growing world of DJI bags for the price. Needed something I could use for both my canon DSlR and my dji mag pro. Fits like a charm and can fit everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Mommielovefun

customer_reviews.title: Pro Photographer
customer_reviews.text: Love! Love! Love! It is the perfect size.. I’m 5’2 and very petite so it’s nice and sleek on my back. Has held up very well
customer_reviews.author: laceabear

customer_reviews.title: but the weight is perfect and it held all my lens and accouterments along ...
customer_reviews.text: Durable. Came in very handy during our recent Bermuda vacation. It is slightly small than it looks in the illustration, but the weight is perfect and it held all my lens and accouterments along with my Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Power

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice bag for the price. Its not too big and not too small. Perfect size for someone that doesnt have a ton of gear but still wants a little bit of extra space.
customer_reviews.author: Get Big

customer_reviews.title: It’s bulky but it’s a durable product!
customer_reviews.text: I like the bag. It’s just a little bulky. The straps seems to be pretty durable but it’s too wide for my shoulders. Definitely made for a wider person. It holds a lot of stuff so that’s a plus. I wish it has a laptop carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sabado

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved the customizable panels. The backpack loks good and does a good job for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: JC Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera bag
customer_reviews.text: I used the bag the next day after receiving it - on a day hike. It was lightweight but gave great protection to the individual lenses, camera, flash, and battery pack I stored in it. It also had space for an additional point and shoot camera. Because of the snug fit, there was no movement within the bag when used. Very comfortable on the back when carrying it. My go-to bag from now on.
customer_reviews.author: TREVOR M DSOUZA

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Great versatile, lightweight, on the go camera bag! It's exactly what I was looking for! I've been using it for a couple weeks now and It hasn't failed me, Zippers are strong, doesn't come unzipped by itself, holds camera up top nicely and houses all ON THE GO CAM EQUIPMENT. I will still buy a larger bag that houses laptop and camera and camera equipment for long road trips and big travels. But for everyday use this is perfect! Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my dSLR body and 3 lenses, 10 filters, cords, and a ton of other small stuff. No zipper issues, sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.author: crs

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose, smaller than you think.
customer_reviews.text: A bit smaller than expected, but it works quite well... I wish the mesh pocket was zippered or had velcro along the whole edge though, anything you put into the pocket fall out when you unzip the bag making it quite impractical.
customer_reviews.author: Lunaap33

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it’s just me....
customer_reviews.text: Bag is a cool beginner bag I don’t like how it fits maybe because I have an athletic build and broad shoulders but even when i extend the straps its doesn’t fit on my back too comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Flyy Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great pack. I fit my Canon T3i
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. I fit my Canon T3i. Rokinon 14mm lens. 18-55mm lens. Tamron 150-600mm lens. 55-250mm lens along with extra batteries and few other accessories. Also holds tripod on outside pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: cody

customer_reviews.title: This bag is bigger & thicker than I was looking ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is bigger & thicker than I was looking for. Too big & heavy for nature walks & light hiking
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The velcro is only in the middle allowing smaller items to slip out easily.
customer_reviews.text: Has plenty of space for enough gear for a day out shooting. Fit inside my carryon fully loaded and ready to use and still left me space for other items. Only thing i wish was different is the pouch on the inside does not have enough velcro on it. The velcro is only in the middle allowing smaller items to slip out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Secundino Medina

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Lots of options for places to put lenses, there is velcro to make the spots bigger if needed and an outside strap to hold a tripod
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Middleton

customer_reviews.title: ... using this for my hairstylist tools and it works great for this purpose it has separate compartments and well ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for my hairstylist tools and it works great for this purpose it has separate compartments and well padded to keep everything safe
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes carrying a backpack over a bag. It keeps his hands free and mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel bag
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bag .. I wish it was a bit bigger... but at the same time I really like the portability of it... with all my stuff in the back fits good on my back for travel. . Love it
customer_reviews.author: Em

product_meta.title: Vivitar Camera Backpack Bag for Sony Canon Fuji Panasonic Nikon DSLR & Mirrorless Digital Camera, Video Camera, Lenses and Photography Accessories - Black Camera Case with Tripod Holder
feature_bullets: MULTI-USE: This lightweight, sturdy backpack offers versatile storage compartments that allow you to fit your camera, photography accessories, and other personal belongings in one safe and convenient place!
FEATURES: Holds a Mirrorless or DSLR camera with a standard zoom lens and allows you to fit extra lenses or camera accessories such as flashlight, battery charger, lens filter set or cleaning kit.
HIGH-QUALITY INTERIOR: Padded customizable modular inserts and mesh compartments fit all your photography gear and includes space for smaller accessories.
CAMERA TRIPOD HOLDER: Dedicated side pocket and strap to keep your tripod securely attached to the bag. Ideal for on-the-go photographers!
SATISFACTION GUARANTEE: Backed with Digital Goja 90-Day 100% Satisfaction Guarantee.
